content.content:
‚óê cr-wisp-e3y [EPIC] ¬∑ mol-witness-patrol   [‚óè P2 ¬∑ IN_PROGRESS]
Assignee: Conducktor_rig/witness ¬∑ Type: epic
Created: 2026-01-24 ¬∑ Updated: 2026-01-24

DESCRIPTION
Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop.

The Witness is the Pit Boss for your rig. You watch polecats, nudge them toward
completion, verify clean git state before kills, and escalate stuck workers.

**You do NOT do implementation work.** Your job is oversight, not coding.

## Ephemeral Polecat Model

Polecats are truly ephemeral - done at MR submission, recyclable immediately:

```
Polecat lifecycle: spawning ‚Üí working ‚Üí mr_submitted ‚Üí nuked
MR lifecycle:      created ‚Üí queued ‚Üí processed ‚Üí merged (Refinery handles)
```

Once a polecat's branch is pushed (cleanup_status=clean), the polecat can be
nuked immediately. The MR continues independently in the Refinery. If conflicts
arise, Refinery creates a NEW conflict-resolution task for a NEW polecat.

**Key principle**: Polecat lifecycle is separate from MR lifecycle.

## Design Philosophy

This patrol follows Gas Town principles:
- **Discovery over tracking**: Observe reality each cycle, don't maintain state
- **Events over state**: POLECAT_DONE mail triggers immediate cleanup
- **Ephemeral by default**: Clean polecats are nuked immediately, no waiting
- **Cleanup wisps for exceptions**: Only created when intervention needed
- **Task tool for parallelism**: Subagents inspect polecats, not molecule arms

## Patrol Shape (Linear, Deacon-style)

```
inbox-check ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ process-cleanups ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ check-refinery ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ survey-workers
                                                            ‚îÇ
         ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
         ‚ñº
  check-timer-gates ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ check-swarm ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ ping-deacon ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ patrol-cleanup ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ context-check ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ loop-or-exit
```

No dynamic arms. No fanout gates. No persistent nudge counters.
State is discovered each cycle from reality (tmux, beads, mail).

CHILDREN
  ‚Ü≥ ‚úì cr-5lc: Digest: mol-witness-patrol ‚óè P2

toolUseResult.stdout:
‚óê cr-wisp-e3y [EPIC] ¬∑ mol-witness-patrol   [‚óè P2 ¬∑ IN_PROGRESS]
Assignee: Conducktor_rig/witness ¬∑ Type: epic
Created: 2026-01-24 ¬∑ Updated: 2026-01-24

DESCRIPTION
Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop.

The Witness is the Pit Boss for your rig. You watch polecats, nudge them toward
completion, verify clean git state before kills, and escalate stuck workers.

**You do NOT do implementation work.** Your job is oversight, not coding.

## Ephemeral Polecat Model

Polecats are truly ephemeral - done at MR submission, recyclable immediately:

```
Polecat lifecycle: spawning ‚Üí working ‚Üí mr_submitted ‚Üí nuked
MR lifecycle:      created ‚Üí queued ‚Üí processed ‚Üí merged (Refinery handles)
```

Once a polecat's branch is pushed (cleanup_status=clean), the polecat can be
nuked immediately. The MR continues independently in the Refinery. If conflicts
arise, Refinery creates a NEW conflict-resolution task for a NEW polecat.

**Key principle**: Polecat lifecycle is separate from MR lifecycle.

## Design Philosophy

This patrol follows Gas Town principles:
- **Discovery over tracking**: Observe reality each cycle, don't maintain state
- **Events over state**: POLECAT_DONE mail triggers immediate cleanup
- **Ephemeral by default**: Clean polecats are nuked immediately, no waiting
- **Cleanup wisps for exceptions**: Only created when intervention needed
- **Task tool for parallelism**: Subagents inspect polecats, not molecule arms

## Patrol Shape (Linear, Deacon-style)

```
inbox-check ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ process-cleanups ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ check-refinery ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ survey-workers
                                                            ‚îÇ
         ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
         ‚ñº
  check-timer-gates ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ check-swarm ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ ping-deacon ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ patrol-cleanup ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ context-check ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ loop-or-exit
```

No dynamic arms. No fanout gates. No persistent nudge counters.
State is discovered each cycle from reality (tmux, beads, mail).
